thinking.disposable_income: Brighton Park is a working-class community with median household income around $43,000, significantly below Chicago's median. Many residents work in manufacturing and service sectors, with about 18% of families below poverty level
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Limited discretionary spending capacity due to lower income levels. Residents are price-sensitive to both transit fares and sales tax increases. Many households spend significant portion of income on basic necessities
thinking.accessibility: Good bus service along major arterials, access to Orange Line at Kedzie and Western stations. About 30% of households don't own vehicles and rely on public transit. Many residents commute to jobs in other parts of the city
thinking.decision_rationale:
1. Prioritize lower transit fares due to high transit dependency and limited income
2. Moderate sales tax preferred as higher rates would burden low-income residents
3. Support some driving fees to improve transit service while not overly burdening car-dependent workers
4. Balance between transit improvement and cost burden on residents
5. Consider proposals that reduce transit travel time to improve access to jobs
